Package model.interfaces

Interface Die

  • public interface Die
     IMPORTANT: implementing classes must provide the following constructor
 
    public DieImpl(int number, int value, int numFaces) throws IllegalArgumentException
    
 @param number - the number of this die in a pair (i.e. die 1 or 2)
 @param value - the face value of this die as it rolls (between 1 .. numFaces)
 @param numFaces - the number of faces of this die (i.e. the maximum value)
 @throws IllegalArgumentException if: 
    number < 1 || > 2 
    || value is < 1 || value > numFaces 
    || numFaces < 1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int NUM_FACES
      number of faces (standard casino dice have 6) Dungeons and Dragons dice have more!

    • Method Summary

    • Field Detail

      • NUM_FACES

        static final int NUM_FACES
        number of faces (standard casino dice have 6) Dungeons and Dragons dice have more!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getNumber

        int getNumber()
        Returns:
        the number of the die in the pair as an int i.e. 1 for Die 1 and 2 for Die 2 NOTE: This only distinguishes the two die so we can roll them at different speeds not to be confused with value which represents the actual face value of the die as it rolls

      • getValue

        int getValue()
        Returns:
        a value between 1 and numFaces

      • getNumFaces

        int getNumFaces()
        Returns:
        the number of faces

      • equals

        boolean equals​(Die die)
        Parameters:
        die - - another Die to compare with
        Returns:
        true if both the value and numFaces are equal (does not compare die number)

      • equals

        boolean equals​(java.lang.Object die)
         NOTE: this is the java.lang.Object @Override
 
 the implementation should cast and call through to the type checked method above
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        die - - another Die to compare with
        Returns:
        true if both the value and numFaces are equal (does not compare die number)

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        NOTE: if equals() is true then generated hashCode should also be equal
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        generated hash code (used by various JCF Collections)

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
         A human readable String that lists the face value of this Die instance
 as a WORD not a digit (see OutputTrace.pdf) 
 
 NOTE: Must use "proper naming" case i.e. First letter capitalised       
 e.g. "One", "Two", "Three" etc.
 
 For simplicity for values greater than 9 you can just output the string "> Nine"
